questions.explanation: The first-order Taylor approximation is f(x) ≈ f(x₀) + f'(x₀)(x - x₀). This is the equation of the tangent line at x₀.

questions.prompt: For a diode with I_Q = 1mA and V_T = 26mV, the small-signal resistance r_d is:

options: The value of the function at equilibrium
The eigenvalues of the Jacobian matrix
The size of the equilibrium region
questions.correctAnswer: The eigenvalues of the Jacobian matrix
questions.explanation: The eigenvalues of the Jacobian at an equilibrium determine local stability. All eigenvalues with negative real parts → stable. Any positive real part → unstable.

questions.explanation: Linearization is a LOCAL approximation. The tangent line only matches the curve near the operating point. Far away, the curvature causes significant deviation.
